owner.username: Jewish Historical Society of the Upper Midwest

title._content: Leona Gordon and her niece, Anita, in Ely

tag.raw: Jewish Historical Society of the Upper Midwest
tag.author: 48143042@N05

description._content: The Gordon family was one of the first Jewish families to settle in Ely. Isadore Gordon left Lithuania and traversed Canada before arriving in Duluth. He worked in the shipyards, and peddled the Range. His customer liked him so well that they loaned him money to open a clothing store in Ely. In the picture, Leona--Isadore's sister-in-law-- and her daughter Anita-- are in the backyard of the Mike Gordon's Ely store: the steps in the background lead to the family home upstairs. Mrs. Rosenbloom, another Jewish Ely resident, is at the right of the picture. The Rosenblooms raised seven children in Ely, and most of them continued on to college at the University of Minnesota. When the Rosenblooms moved to Minneapolis in 1943, the family store became the Ely American Legion Hall. Date: 1921? Source: 9 cm x 12.5 cm Format: Black and white original photo Subject: Business and industry; Portraits; Gordon, Leona; Gamson, Anita Gordon Coverage: Ely; St. Louis; Minnesota; United States Local Identifier: P-23 Link to our record: http://reflections.mndigital.org/u?/jhs,410 From the Steinfeldt Photography Collection of the Jewish Historical Society of the Upper Midwest.
